Description:
Live the Country and Coast Lifestyle
The Feel:
Set on 2.5 acres (approx) this stunning residence has an vast array of features from the luxe kitchen, formal living rooms and incredible gardens. This home will appeal to many. Situated to enjoy the best of beach and bush, Ocean Groves surf and amenities are minutes away, and the local primary school is just around the corner. Ideal for families seeking the enormous benefits of life on acreage, this extensive property provides so much.
The Facts:
-Contemporary 3BR plus study home on 2.5 (approx). picturesque acres
-Tree lined driveway leads to home, set back from the road, with 100% privacy
-Rural lifestyle opportunity in tightly held Rhinds Rd, Wallington
-Living zones maximise the sunny North & West aspects, with a private, protected entertaining area
-Large kitchen positioned in the heart of the home, under high ceilings w/ stone island benchtop
-Smeg oven, Electrolux induction cooktop, Asko dishwasher & large Walk in Pantry
-2nd living offers formal lounge & dining room with garden views, large hearth & open fire place
-Bedrooms have fully fitted BIRs & enjoy garden views
-Master bedroom with ensuite with large shower & toilet
-Separate bedroom wing with bathroom, separate toilet & spa bath
-Stunning european Oak parquetry flooring
-Seasonal comfort with open fireplace, SSAC as well as ceiling fans
-Mature Orchard (40 trees) producing a range of fruit incl Apple, Pear, Nectarine, Peach and Cherry etc
-Mature Citrus incl Lime & Lemon
-DLUG with solid concrete flooring & internal door access to large workshop, ensuite, kitchen and 2 more separate store rooms
-13,500L Rainwater tank for garden & drinking, plus town water supply
-Only 5mins to Gateway Plaza SC, less than 10mins to Ocean Grove shops, cafes & beach
The Owner Loves.
I love the family/kitchen room, with the garden views through every window, it is such a very peaceful and comfortable home to be inside

Description:
Modern Coastal Design
This stunning residence marks a new era of contemporary coastal development in St Leonards. A captivating facade incorporates classic angles and innovative materials to create a property that has amazing street presence.
Combining a sleek modern finish and a seamless merge of outdoor and indoor living the property boasts charm, elegance and an unrivalled seaside lifestyle. This fantastic residence is a standout property on today's market and offers luxury and comfort at an affordable price. Situated less than 650m to the white sandy shores of Port Phillip Bay and the local social hub of the St Leonards Yacht Club, the luxuries of this location extend beyond the home itself. Additionally, the picturesque walking trails of the St Leonards foreshore and Edwards Point Wildlife Reserve are within easy reach ensuring residents of this home are surrounded by beauty.
But the beauty of this residence isn't just in it's surrounds. The open-plan kitchen/living/dining room is a beautiful space to conduct your daily activities. The area is flooded with natural light which flows through numerous large windows, making the most of the northerly aspect. The use of polished-concrete floors and neutral tones combine to give the home a modern appeal within the home's coastal character. The kitchen features a stainless-steel, Siemens wall-oven, gas cook-top and ample storage space. The area is heated and cooled using reverse-cycle air-conditioning.
The master retreat is located upstairs and features walk-in robe, ensuite and ocean glimpses. This room is heated and cooled by a separate reverse-cycle air-conditioning unit. The two remaining bedrooms are located downstairs one of which features a walk-in robe. Both are serviced by a conveniently located bathroom and separate toilet.
Externally the home features a double carport with a handy storeroom adjacent. The home is completed by a delightful and secluded courtyard garden with attached alfresco area providing the perfect place to relax after a day at the beach.

Description:
UNDER OFFER
Situated on a 1,061m2 (approx.) allotment this three bedroom family home, with a superb mature garden, is sure to impress. The options are endless in terms of entertainment as this home is located less than 350m from the sparkling shores of Port Phillip Bay and less than 250m from the picturesque walking trails of Edwards Point Wildlife Reserve. With the boutique township of St Leonards only 5 minutes drive away - everything you need is at your fingertips.
The open-plan kitchen/living/dining area is flooded with natural light through large windows and provides the perfect location to entertain a large family. The large, functional kitchen is located at the heart of the home and features an electric-oven and cook-top as well as ample storage space. This kitchen also enjoys fabulous garden views that make this room an ideal place to relax and enjoy the magnificent bird life that inhabit the native garden.
The open-plan family/lounge area adjoins the kitchen/dining/living area and provides an expansive space for the family to be entertained. With exposed timber beams providing character, this room has a certain 'age-old' charm that creates a delightfully relaxing space. The room is heated by a gas heater ensuring comfort on those chilly Winter nights.
All three bedrooms feature built-in-robes with the large master bedroom also featuring a ceiling fan. All bedrooms share a functional family bathroom and separate toilet.
The real gem of this property is the garden - it really creates a sense of being in a private oasis. The huge lawn area is divided by character-filled brick pathways and the mature native and exotic trees that intersperse the property provide the ideal shady backdrop for a Summer BBQ. With an in-built BBQ, two storage sheds and it's own gazebo this garden really has everything you could desire.
This property needs to be seen to be believed! Book an inspection today.

Description:
Family Living At Its Finest
The Feel:
Boasting bay views & close proximity to Drysdale village, this custom-built family home (HIA Awards finalist) is located in a prestigious locale. This substantial property comprises 4 sizable bedrooms, including a grand master with private balcony & Bay views, his 'n' hers WIRs & a spa en-suite with twin vanities & double shower. Four living areas include a home theatre room, entertainers kitchen & the convenience of a home office at the entry. Space & style is yours on Sundial Drive.
The Facts:
-Custom 2-storey urban lifestyle property w/ zoned floorplan for entertaining & family life
-Elevated Master captures panoramic views of Corio Bay, the You Yangs & surrounding countryside
-Spacious, light-filled living areas & outstanding design features
-Seamless connection to private entertaining area with merbau decking
-High ceilings, wide tiled entry & Southern Box floating floors extend the sense of spaciousness
-Superb fixtures, custom window furnishings & quality carpet flooring throughout
-Ducted Inverter heating & cooling ensures total comfort
-Front entry with adjacent private home office
-Cinema with raised seating platform, 4K Ultra HD Projector, 100 fixed screen & surround sound
-Cinema lounges are included in sale
-Family lounge with 50 tv & direct access to protected alfresco entertaining
-OP kitchen/dining/living at the rear with cosy gas log fire
-Chefs kitchen w/ superior European appliances & enormous WI butler's pantry w/ additional sink.
-Smeg 900mm gas/electric cooker & range hood, Bosch dishwasher & glass splashback
-Fully equipped laundry with laundry chute & walk-in storeroom
-Powder room convenient to the living zones
-Understair storeroom & ample storage throughout
-5-star master suite with 42 tv, bay-view balcony, His n Hers WIRs & luxurious en-suite
-En-suite with bay-view spa bath, twin vanities, double shower & separate WC
-Remote control ceiling fans in all bedrooms
-Generous upper living zone with built-in storage & 42 tv
-Dedicated "kids' level" with living room, big bathroom which includes bath, shower, laundry chute & separate WC & 2 BRs with BIRs & study areas
-RC DLUG with exposed agg concrete driveway & internal access
-Additional highlights inc: ducted heating, refrigerated cooling, 5.5kW solar & ducted vacuum
-Set within a short walk of all family amenities, shopping and a choice of schools
-In the heart of The Bellarine, well-known for wineries, beaches & watersports
The Owner Loves.
Raising a family in a home that is so accessible & well planned has been a joy. We love the open plan kitchen & living area that brings everyone together, with plenty of space for everyone to enjoy quiet time & study. Our days often conclude with a glass of wine overlooking the Bay & You Yangs on our private balcony.

Address: 118 Beacon Point Road Clifton Springs VIC 3222
Description:
LOOKS CAN BE DECEIVING
Due to COVID-19 Regulations, Inspections are by appointment only. Wearing of masks and social distancing apply. Contact agent to organise a time.
Looks can be deceiving, there is more behind the door of this home than what you would expect when you do a drive by. Not only one living area but two, not only three bedrooms but the option of a fourth or study.
The back yard is also larger than you would imagine too. Rarely do the kid's balls go over the fence. If they do itâs a very big kick! Vegie patches exist to feed the ever growing family. Enjoy the Undercover entertainment area with a view of the pretty garden and lush green grass.
The current owners have enjoyed being close to all the open spaces and parks for the kids to run. They have enjoyed being close to the water all year round. They are likely to remain in the area as it offers all they require plus more.
There is a choice of schools, medical centres, sporting clubs, dance groups, but wait there's more: Restaurants, cafes, bike trails etc. One of the many highlights of living here is the Bellarine Tourist Railway. Runs from Queenscliff to Drysdale on weekends and during the week in the school holidays.
What is your wish list for a home? Are you looking to downsize, buy your first home or invest? This home would be the perfect solution for any of the above options.
Tucked behind a high fence on a 609m2 (approx) it is a very quiet place to escape to.
Would you like to see whatâs behind the fence? Well call me to book a time to check it out.

Description:
Seachange Luxury
Let your seaside ambitions come true with this immaculate home which exudes a touch of luxury rarely seen. This property is 'turn-key' ready and waiting for you to enjoy the coastal lifestyle at St Leonards. Situated less than 2km to the delightful township of St Leonards and just over 2km to the sparkling blue waters of Port Phillip Bay this home offers easy access to all local amenities.
The open-plan kitchen/living/dining area exhibits a modern design that will make you the envy of all your friends. The neutral tones used throughout this room create spacious and bright home. The kitchen features a stainless-steel oven and cook-top as well as a huge walk-in-pantry. Comfortable temperatures are maintained in this area through the use of a reverse-cycle air-conditioner.
The master bedroom, situated at the front of the home away from the main living area, features ensuite, walk-in-robe and reverse-cycle air-conditioner. The two minor bedrooms feature their own ensuites, built-in-robes and reverse-cycle air-conditioners. This luxurious touch is a rare feature with all bedrooms boasting their own ensuites.
Externally the home features double lock-up garage with internal access and fully landscaped front and rear gardens. Call for an inspection today!

Description:
Lot 544 Jules Street, Seachange Estate
The latest extension to the beautiful Seachange Estate at St.Leonards, Stage 11A to be released - 9am 24th September 2018.
With lots ranging from 300sqm to over 500sqm and with frontages from 12m to 16m (and everything in between) there really is something to suit everyone's lifestyle and budget.
The quality of the previous stages is available for all to see with the landscaping themes to be continued into the next stages. Of particular note will be the palm tree lined dual carriage way entry boulevard as well as over 5 acres of wetland reserve available for passive recreation.
Less than 90 minutes from Melbourne and 30 minutes from Geelong 'Seachange' represents outstanding value for money and is no doubt why it is selling so quickly.
- Over 500 Lots sold in only 14 months
- Walk to the beach
- 1 hectare reserve with multi-aged playground, pavilion, soccer goal & half basketball court.
Stage 11A is to be released at 9am on the 24th of September 2018 – register your interest NOW!
www.seachangeestate.com.au

Description:
Coast Meets The Sea
The Feel:
Situated on just under 2 acres of private land in prestigious Wallington, this solid brick home offers family living with all the fun of sunny entertaining areas, & a solar-heated, salt-chlorinated pool. Combining privacy, lifestyle, location & entertainment, the living spaces face north, with 4 bedrooms & a study satisfying the needs of a large family. Enjoy pool parties, ride horses out the back, & embrace rural living... all just minutes by car to Ocean Grove shops & beaches & 20 mins to Geelong.
The Facts:
-Classic 4BR+study solid brick home on just under 2 picturesque acres
-Rural lifestyle opportunity in Wallington, w/ low maintenance landscaped gardens & large paddock at the rear
-Salt-chlorinated, solar heated 10x5m (approx.), 60,000L pool with paved surrounds
-Powered/plumbed pool house with 6 seater spa, bar fridge, outdoor sound system, lighting, bar & decks
-Living & entertaining zone faces north, sliding doors maximise sunny aspects & relaxed way of life
-Classic blackwood country kitchen w/ slate tiles & leadlight windows is central heart of the home
-Miele electric wall oven, induction cooktop, rangehood & Bosch dishwasher
-Views from the kitchen to the pool and the horses & south garden with a bottle tree, camellias & hibiscus trees
-Open plan meals & living area with Coonara, overlooking the alfresco area & pool
-2nd living room is a sunny space overlooking the pool, zoned off with double sliding doors
-North-facing Master BR with deck, garden views, BIRs, en-suite (shower/vanity/toilet/ IXL Tastic)
-3 more bedrooms off the hall, all with mirrored BIRs & garden outlooks
-Family bathroom with bath, shower, blackwood vanity, slate tiles, skylight, IXL Tastic, leadlight windows & separate toilet
-Brand new hot water service, split system heating and AC, new carpet in all BRs & 2nd living
-Adjoining laundry room with linen storage
-SLUG with circular driveway & OSP for 3-4 cars
-8.7 x 3m workshop/tool shed
-Study with separate entry that can be used for a home office: with direct access to the road via side paddock
-Septic with Aquacycle system for irrigation of paddocks
-Large 1.5 acre (approx.) paddock with bluegum lined side access, great shade, water trough, dam
-Space & facilities to have horses, with double horse shelter, horse yard & mains powered electric fencing
-Secure fenced area around house for kids & pets, w/ Hills Hoist & a garden shed
-Freshly mulched gardens feature lemons, palms, agaves, natives, roses & daisies en masse
-Versatile shedding for chooks, horse feed storage & gated area that could be utilised as a dog run
-Seasonal comfort with 7kw SSAC & Coonara wood heater in main living/dining, as well as ceiling fan in master bedroom and outdoor alfresco area
-School bus stop at the front gate
-The Paddock Café is only 500m away for coffee
-20mins to Geelong, 6mins to cafes & beaches in Ocean Grove
The Owner Loves.
There is so much to love about this home... From swimming in the pool on hot summer nights, to riding horses out through the back gate; its great to be so close to the beach, schools and work, yet living the rural lifestyle with our horses and the amazing bird life including the flying bricks, wedge tail eagles, kookaburras and rainbow lorikeets.

Description:
Short Stroll To The Waterfront
The Clifton Springs and Curlewis north facing waterfronts are both just a short stroll along the Griggs Creek walking track from this rejuvenated 3 bedroom 2 bathroom BV home. Freshly painted and with new carpets, the home enjoys a formal lounge and master bedroom at the front with an open and light filled north facing lounge and 2 further bedrooms at the rear. The outdoor entertaining flows on from the open plan living, whilst the back yard of the 685 sqm block is accessed via double gates perfect for the boat or caravan. The fantastic list of extras in this home include gas central heating, reverse cycle split system air conditioning, ample off street parking, double glazing in front windows and a Clifton Springs Primary school catchment position.

Description:
Superb Family Home
Enjoy a comfortable, family-orientated lifestyle in this huge three bedroom home with four separate living spaces. Situated in a quiet cul-de-sac, less than 800m to the white sandy beaches of Port Phillip Bay, the location of this home creates a relaxed, coastal lifestyle. With the boutique coffee strip of St Leonards less than 1.5km away you will have plenty of entertainment at your fingertips - this home really offers a lifestyle that is hard to match.
The enormous, open-plan kitchen/family/dining room offers plenty of space for a family to conduct it's daily activities. The kitchen features stainless-steel appliances, induction cook-top and walk-in pantry.
Space is a feature of this home with three additional living areas to entertain the family. The lounge room sits at the front of the home and provides the perfect reception room to greet guests. The living room, at the rear of the home, offers the ideal location to house family activities, while the enclosed entertaining area provides the additional space a family needs to remain at peace. The home is heated by ducted gas-heating and cooled by evaporative cooling air-conditioning. Temperature can also be adjusted by the use of the two reverse-cycle air-conditioners.
The master bedroom is situated at the front of the home and features an ensuite and walk-in-robe. The two remaining bedrooms can be found at the rear of the home and are serviced by a conveniently located bathroom and separate toilet.
Space features again in the exterior of the home with a double lock-up garage, with internal access, and a separate single lock-up garage in the rear yard. Additionally, there is undercover storage for a boat accessed by the drive-through roller-door in the garage. The home has a 5kW, 16 panel solar system and is completed by landscaped front and rear gardens complete with mature fruit-bearing citrus trees.

Description:
Pristine, charming cottage in Point Lonsdale
The eye to detail in this delightful, compact cottage is truly inspiring. The owners have not left a stone unturned creating "Beachwood Cottage" through savvy design and an artisan-built interior.
Maintaining a single garage at the front, the elevated entrance presents a central passage, with subtle oak flooring (the oak being a constant recurring theme throughout the cabinetry and fittings).
Behind sliding doors, the west side of the passage features a Euro-style laundry, a powder room, a bathroom with shower and heated towel rail, and two separate WC's and vanities. On the east side, two bedrooms enjoy garden views through finely-crafted sash windows, plus built-in robes. At the rear, a cosy kitchen/dining/lounge opens onto a covered deck that's primed for alfresco entertainment. The kitchen features state-of-the-art Miele appliances including integrated fridge/freezer and dishwasher, and the laid-back lounge overlooks a neat, low-maintenance native garden and rear shed. There's also an outside shower and water tank, and a single garage with great storage space.
Little expense has been spared - with numerous luxury fittings, subtle contemporary lighting, ducted heating and cooling throughout. This fully insulated home is complemented by a beautifully landscaped native garden including irrigation system. A further undoubted bonus is the cottage's location - right beside a large nature park and playground.
- A charming cottage boasts beautifully crafted interior with state-of-the-art fittings
- Two bedrooms, bathroom, two separate WC's, powder room, laundry
- Kitchen/dining/lounge opens to covered entertainment deck
- Miele appliances, ducted heating/cooling, single garage/ ample storage
- Low-maintenance native gardens and adjacent to nature park

Description:
Seaside Living
You are able to view this property 7 days a week by private inspection. We have created an environment to look and purchase safely. Please contact us to arrange a time to do so.
Welcome to St Leonards, a iconic country town situated on the Bellarine Peninsula.
A town well known for it's boating and fishing and has been a great getaway for generations of holiday makers.
Approximately 512 sqm of prime positioned land, located minutes from central St Leonards; the shops, cafes, eateries and beach are all within your reach.
A sought after location and a fantastic lifestyle awaits you in the Seachange Estate
Being only 30 minutes from Geelong, and even shorter to "his and her's" shops, Bunnings and Kmart at Gateway Plaza in Leopold, this is prime real estate and is only missing you.

Description:
Modern Living in the Superb Seachange Estate
This beautiful home is move-in ready and has been completed with all of the finest finishes available. It is perfect for the family home, investment property or holiday home.
The home is situated in the new Seachange Estate neighborhood offering the opportunity to soak up the relaxed St Leonards lifestyle while still having the fantastic wetlands and the Seachange parks close by.
The home has an open plan layout with substantial living areas giving a sense of space, and the adjoining, private, outside decked area creates the perfect place for those who love to entertain.
The side access to this property makes this home an extremely versatile living environment offering space for the caravan, boat or just another additional enclosed parking space.
Landscaped low maintenance front and back gardens make this remarkable property an inspection that should be fast tracked.
Other notable features are as follows:
~ Stone bench tops in the kitchen.
~ 900mm stainless steel oven, gas cooktop and canopy rangehood.
~ High 8.5 foot ceilings.
~ Master bedrooms has two walk in robes.
~ Laminated-timber floors to entry through to the kitchen, meals and family areas
~ Walk in pantry

Description:
Stunning Quality Home
This immaculately maintained double-storey contemporary style home is located on a quiet yet central road in St Leonards with parklands to the West, providing unobstructed views and a peaceful environment.
This stunning home oozes quality and charm and features a magnificent central kitchen complete with massive Caesar stone dining/prep bench, WIP, more than ample storage, USB charging port and SMEG stainless-steel appliances including a 900mm, 5-burner stove.
A warm and cosy adjoining lounge boasts an electric fireplace which opens out to a private decking area whilst the spacious kitchen/family area leads out to the alfresco deck and beautiful backyard.
This delightful home offers three generous bedrooms, all with WIR's and the master with luxurious ensuite, plus a study.
Bonus features include zoned electric ducted-heating/refrigerated-cooling, security deadlocks and additional locks on windows plus 4 TV outlets scattered throughout the home.
Heading outside, you'll find an oversized remote DLUG with second laundry, a hot/cold external water source for washing your boat and fish after a successful day down by the bay, plus an extra under cover boat/caravan space, accessible via the 2.4m wide back gate.
A self contained apartment can be found above the garage with complete kitchenette, living area and bathroom, providing a great retreat for guests or teenage children.
This magnificent home is sure to impress so if you're after quality, location and an easy to maintain home, then look no further!

Address: 19-23 High Ridge Drive Clifton Springs VIC 3222
Description:
STUNNING BAY VIEWS , PRIVATE LUSH GARDENS AND SUSTAINABLE LIVING!
The earth will provide, this amazing property comes with an orchard and raised garden beds for vegetables straight to the table. The garden is a haven and frames this large solid home with your very own rainforest, which has easy to maintain matured plants, ferns, a Bromeliad collection and so much colour from the various natives and flowers. The home enjoys a formal entrance with generous lounge room, formal dining and huge second open plan space with meals, well equipped kitchen and living overlooking the atrium into the rainforest. The dwelling has been strategically positioned to achieve sunlight from its northerly orientation whilst the panoramic bay views over the vast gardens are like framed pictures through the windows. The 4 bedroom home features a master with ensuite, spa and dressing room, three further bedrooms with BIR'S all have garden and bay views, central bathroom, separate toilet and laundry. Features include gas hydronic floor heating, 2 solar hotwater units, 12 panel 3kw solar system, gas wall heater, evaporative cooling, ducted vacuum, Indian hand cut slate floor tiling, Tasmanian blackwood cabinetry & huge pantry. Outside has 16,000L of rainwater storage, electric pump plumbed to garden taps, storage, greenhouse and much more. Entertaining is easy with large verandas, undercover BBQ space, rotunda with views and gardens or just relax in your favourite spot with your cocktail or afternoon tea. A double garage & extra large workshop flow into a brilliant space suitable for a mancave, gym or storage space for the toys. With an abundance of nature, space and privacy this wonderful home nourishes the body & soul while living and enjoying the beauty of the Bellarine Peninsula's wine, food, beaches.....sheer bliss.

Address: 2/5 Bay Shore Avenue Clifton Springs VIC 3222
Description:
BEAUTY ON BAY SHORE
Due to COVID-19 Regulations, inspections are by appointment only. Wearing of masks and social distancing apply. Contact agent to organise a time.
As we do life circumstances change and decisions need to be made. My Vendor has thoroughly enjoyed living here but now it's time for a change.
The lounge and dining room are on the west side of the home to benefit from the afternoon sun and provide a bright and cosy atmosphere. This central living zone features a gas wall heater as well as a split system A/C. The big draw card of the property is that the master bedroom has a WIR and an ensuite bathroom which is very rarely seen in this price bracket.
Being the rear unit it is discreetly tucked away from the street so road noise will never be a problem. The car will be secure in the single lock up garage.
Clifton Springs is a suburb on the edge of Corio Bay so if you enjoy walking a stroll down to the water's edge will reveal the You Yangs and the large ships moving in and out for the Bay. Yachts really enjoy this bay too. Enquire today for your private inspection.

Description:
Seachange Estate Lot 612 Reardon Crescent
Seachange Estate offers the spoils of a coastal lifestyle with the convenience of landscaped wetlands, reserves and walking tracks. Enjoy a leisurely morning walk along the foreshore or wander down to the town centre for a coffee and a catch-up with friends.
The latest extension to the beautiful Seachange Estate at St. Leonards is located only 500m from the beach. With lots ranging from 300sqm to over 720sqm and with frontages from 10m to 20m (and everything in between) there really is something to suit everyone's lifestyle and budget.
The quality of the previous stages is available for all to see with the landscaping themes to be continued into the next stages. Of note will be the palm tree lined dual carriage way entry boulevard off the new Leviens Road main entry as well as acres of wetland reserves at the front entry available for passive recreation.
The lot on offer is Lot 612 Reardon Crescent and titling Approx. August 2020.
Width: Approx. 14m
Depth: Approx. 25m
Less than 90 minutes from Melbourne and 30 minutes from Geelong 'Seachange' represents outstanding value for money and is no doubt why it is selling so quickly.
Contact Trevor McManus on 0448 810 074 for more information.

Description:
Paradise on the Rise
You are able to view this property 7 days a week by private inspection. We have created an environment to look and purchase safely. Please contact us to arrange a time to do so.
Question: Why is living in this house in Portarlington so special.
When you have 180-degree views of Port Phillip bay during the day and a night time spectacular view, an arc of the lights of Melbourne and `suburbs, not to mention the ships coming and going from Melbourne and Geelong.
Water views from up and down stairs. All Mountain Ash timber flooring.
The house has a master bedroom with fitted built in robes, ensuite double shower, separate toilet. Walk from the master to a separate under cover deck with amazing views to the East;
The sunrise is something to be seen to believe.
The other two bedrooms with adjoining bathroom with separate shower and bath again with
separate toilet room are in a private part of the house, which is ideal for guests, but also lends itself
to B&B possibilities.
Down stairs living area and a separate study area with a wall of built in cupboards and shelves. Light
coming from two directions, the living area has double opening door leading to a concrete patio.
The laundry has a full wall of floor to ceiling robes on one side and top and bottom cupboards on the
other, leads through a sliding to another concrete area into the rear yard.
Large under stair area which has been used as an office, computer and electrical fittings.
Upstairs spacious living area leads to a separate under cover deck with amazing North and Westerly
views to the mountains over the bay, the sunsets well you have to see them. A modern kitchen with
butler's pantry fitted with an abundance of built in shelving for all the storage you would need.
The country style kitchen has 5 burner cooktop with rangehood, work appliance pantry and centre
storage with a bank of roll out drawers with a polished Blackwood top.
Double garage with 5M remote roller door, separate workshop area with more storage and shelving.
Large 623 SqM block fully landscaped with nothing to spend, solar hot water and water tank with its own pump for the garden.
Back to why it is special, walk to the many beautiful restaurants and café's not to mention Daniels Donuts.
There are many music festivals and markets within a short walking distance throughout the year.
Walk to the Ferry for an interesting hassle-free trip to Melbourne for a day or weekend, return by
Ferry refreshed, a short walk home. (no car needed)
Sit on your own undercover deck on New Year's Eve with a glass of your favourite in hand and watch a spectacular fireworks display.
All of this is what makes it special.
Internal area
334m²
